text: The 1971 European Cup Final was a football match. It was between Ajax of the Netherlands and Panathinaikos of Greece. ==Route to the final== Ajax Ajax Ajax Ajax Round Panathinaikos Panathinaikos Panathinaikos Panathinaikos Opponent Agg. 1st leg 2nd leg Opponent Agg. 1st leg 2nd leg 17 Nëntori Tirana 4–2 2–2 (A) 2–0 (H) First round Jeunesse Esch 7–1 2–1 (A) 5–0 (H) Basel 5–1 3–0 (H) 2–1 (A) Second round Slovan Bratislava 4–2 3–0 (H) 1–2 (A) Celtic 3–1 3–0 (H) 0–1 (A) Quarter-finals Everton 1–1 (a) 1–1 (A) 0–0 (H) Atlético Madrid 3–1 0–1 (A) 3–0 (H) Semi-finals Red Star Belgrade 4–4 (a) 1–4 (A) 3–0 (H) ==Match== ===Details=== {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" GK 1 Heinz Stuy SW 2 Velibor Vasović (c) RB 3 Wim Suurbier CB 4 Barry Hulshoff LB 6 Nico Rijnders RM 7 Johan Neeskens CM 8 Sjaak Swart LM 9 Gerrie Mühren RF 10 Dick van Dijk CF 11 Piet Keizer LF 14 Johan Cruyff Substitutes: Substitutes: Substitutes: DF 12 Horst Blankenburg MF 15 Arie Haan GK 13 MF 5 Manager: Manager: Manager: Rinus Michels Rinus Michels Rinus Michels Rinus Michels ==Related pages== * 1970–71 European Cup * 1971 Intercontinental Cup * AFC Ajax in European football * Panathinaikos F.C. in European football ==Other websites== * 1970-71 season at UEFA website European Cup Final European Cup Final Category:AFC Ajax Category:Football in England Category:UEFA Champions League finals
